prompt:
Sophia is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 13), my wife (birthday on September 19), my child_1 (birthday on September 06), my father (birthday on July 27), my mother (birthday on June 05), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 24-25.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

response:
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

I found myself diving deep into research for the energy-efficient building design, which has become a focal point for me. At home, the kids adjusted well to school, and we had a family game night on Saturday to unwind. The week ended with a cozy Sunday dinner, where we reflected on the past week and looked forward to the coming months.

prompt:
Emma is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 11), my wife (birthday on March 02), my child_1 (birthday on September 11), my father (birthday on August 19), my mother (birthday on August 30), 
2) Participating in a week-long sailing school in week 26-27.

3) Participate in a kite flying club every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 11.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Emma for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

response:
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

#*# Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week began with a flurry of activity as we settled back into our routines. The weather remained chilly, but the sun shone brightly, casting a crisp light over everything. Work was busy, with meetings and brainstorming sessions filling up my schedule. My team and I are working on a project that aims to integrate renewable energy sources into existing building structures, which is both exciting and challenging. At home, the kids adjusted well to school, and my wife and I found time to plan our upcoming vacation. We're thinking about a beach destination for the summer, something to look forward to during these cold months. On the weekend, we visited my parents, who were thrilled to see us. We spent the day catching up and enjoying a hearty meal together. It was a comforting reminder of the importance of family bonds.

#*# Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
The third week of the year brought a mix of work and family activities. The weather remained cold, but there was a hint of spring in the air, with occasional sunny spells. At work, we continued to make progress on the renewable energy project, and I had several productive discussions with colleagues. My wife and I also attended a local art exhibit, which was a refreshing break from the daily grind. The kids were excited about their school projects, particularly a science fair they’re preparing for. On the weekend, we participated in a community cleanup event, which was both rewarding and a great way to spend time outdoors. The sense of community and teamwork was inspiring, and it felt good to contribute to our neighborhood.

#*# Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
This week was filled with a mix of routine and special moments. The weather remained cold, but the days were getting slightly longer. At work, we finalized the initial phase of the renewable energy project and presented it to upper management, receiving positive feedback. My wife and I took the kids to a local ice rink, where they learned to skate. It was a fun and bonding experience, and the kids were thrilled to try something new. We also celebrated my husband’s birthday early this week, as his actual birthday falls in May. We had a small gathering with close friends and family, and everyone enjoyed a delicious cake and shared heartfelt wishes. The week ended with a cozy evening at home, watching a movie and reflecting on the past year.

#*# Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
The start of February brought a slight thaw, with temperatures rising a bit. At work, we continued to refine the renewable energy project, and I spent most of the week collaborating with my team. My wife and I focused on organizing our finances for the year, setting budgets and reviewing savings goals. The kids were busy with schoolwork and extracurricular activities, including a school play rehearsal. On the weekend, we visited a local museum, which featured an exhibition on ancient civilizations. It was educational and fascinating, sparking conversations about history and culture. The week concluded with a family dinner, where we shared our favorite parts of the week and made plans for the coming month.

#*# Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th):
This week was a blend of work and family activities. The weather remained mild, with occasional rain showers. At work, we had a series of meetings to discuss the next steps for the renewable energy project. My wife and I attended a parenting workshop, which provided valuable insights into supporting our children's emotional and academic growth. The kids were excited about their upcoming school play, and we spent the weekend helping them practice their lines. We also took a short trip to a nearby town, exploring its charming streets and enjoying a leisurely lunch at a local café. The week ended with a family game night, filled with laughter and friendly competition.

The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the office was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promised challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brought a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

Benjamin is a architect with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 14), my wife (birthday on January 19), my child_1 (birthday on January 01), my child_2 (birthday on March 16), my father (birthday on December 06), 
2) Joining a fitness and wellness retreat in Bali in week 32-33.

3) Attend DIY home improvement workshops every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 15.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 17), my wife (birthday on March 12), my child_1 (birthday on April 06), my child_2 (birthday on December 13), my father (birthday on January 04),

 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 75 for conference room use.
  - Designate Floor 12 for office use.
  - Designate Floor 64 for legal services use.
  - Designate Floor 99 for boutique use.
  - Designate Floor 35 for veterinary clinic use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 49 to 54 for a extensive fitness and recreational gym.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a observatory every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. 3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a dining area every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.

Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.

#*# Floor 2: The second floor is dedicated to the main office spaces, providing a modern and efficient working environment. The open-plan layout encourages collaboration and communication among employees. Large windows allow natural light to flood the space, enhancing productivity and creating a pleasant atmosphere. The walls are painted in neutral tones, complemented by vibrant artwork that adds a touch of color and creativity. High-quality furniture, including ergonomic chairs and adjustable desks, ensures comfort during long hours of work. The floor also includes several meeting rooms equipped with state-of-the-art technology for video conferencing and presentations.

#*# Floor 3: This floor houses the executive offices, offering a more private and luxurious setting compared to the open-plan areas on the lower levels. Each office is spacious and well-lit, with large windows providing stunning views of the city skyline. The interiors feature high-end finishes, such as hardwood flooring and custom-built cabinetry. Comfortable leather sofas and chairs are placed in designated areas for informal discussions and relaxation. The executive bathrooms are equipped with premium fixtures and amenities, ensuring a luxurious experience for the occupants.

#*# Floor 4: The fourth floor is designed as a communal workspace, promoting a collaborative and innovative environment. The space includes various zones, such as quiet areas for focused work, brainstorming rooms for creative sessions, and social hubs for casual interactions. The furniture is flexible and adaptable, allowing users to customize their workspaces according to their needs. The floor also features a large break room equipped with a fully stocked kitchen, comfortable seating, and entertainment options like a TV and gaming consoles.

  - Designate Floor 36 for office use.
  - Designate Floor 19 for library use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 61 to 67 for a comprehensive library with study areas and archives.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a observatory every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1:

Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).

This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.

#*# Floor 2: 
The second floor is dedicated to retail spaces, offering a variety of shops and services to cater to the needs of the building's occupants and visitors. Key features include: 1) Retail Spaces: A mix of high-end boutiques, cafes, and convenience stores line the corridors, providing a diverse range of products and services. 2) Open Layout: The floor plan is designed to be open and inviting, encouraging foot traffic and exploration. 3) Lighting and Decor: Soft, warm lighting and stylish decor enhance the shopping experience, making it both functional and enjoyable. This floor aims to create a vibrant commercial hub within the skyscraper, fostering a lively atmosphere and supporting the daily activities of its users.

#*# Floor 3: 
The third floor is designated for fitness and wellness facilities, promoting health and wellbeing among the building's occupants. Key features include: 1) Gymnasium: A spacious gym equipped with state-of-the-art exercise machines and free weights, catering to various fitness levels and goals. 2) Yoga Studio: A serene space for yoga and meditation classes, complete with mats and props. 3) Sauna and Spa: Relaxation areas including a sauna, steam room, and massage therapy rooms. This floor provides a comprehensive suite of wellness amenities, encouraging a healthy lifestyle and stress relief for the building's residents and workers.

#*# Floor 4: 
The fourth floor houses administrative offices, providing a professional workspace for various businesses and organizations. Key features include: 1) Office Suites: Modular office spaces that can be customized to meet the specific needs of different tenants. 2) Conference Rooms: Equipped with advanced audio-visual technology and comfortable seating, these rooms facilitate productive meetings and presentations. 3) Break Areas: Comfortable lounges where employees can take breaks and socialize, enhancing collaboration and team spirit. This floor offers a versatile and efficient environment for conducting business operations.

#*# Floor 5: 
The fifth floor is allocated for educational purposes, hosting classrooms and learning centers. Key features include: 1) Classrooms: Spacious rooms equipped with interactive whiteboards, projectors, and comfortable seating for students. 2) Study Areas: Quiet zones with ample tables and chairs for individual or group study sessions. 3) Library: A small collection of books and resources to support learning activities. This floor fosters a conducive learning environment, enabling continuous education and personal development for the building's occupants.

#*# Floor 6: 
The sixth floor is dedicated to residential units, offering luxurious living spaces for individuals and families. Key features include: 1) Apartment Units: Well-designed apartments with modern kitchens, bathrooms, and living areas. 2) Balconies: Each unit has access to a private balcony with stunning views of the cityscape. 3) Amenities: Shared facilities such as laundry rooms and storage lockers are available for resident convenience. This floor provides a comfortable and convenient living experience within the skyscraper.

#*# Floor 7: 
The seventh floor is reserved for recreational activities, featuring a variety of entertainment options. Key features include: 1) Game Room: Equipped with pool tables, foosball, and other games for leisure and fun. 2) Movie Theater: A private cinema with plush seating and a large screen for movie nights. 3) Outdoor Terrace: A rooftop deck with seating areas and grilling stations for outdoor gatherings. This floor offers a range of entertainment options, promoting relaxation and social interaction among the building's occupants.

#*# Floor 8: 
The eighth floor is designated for medical and healthcare services, providing on-site medical care and wellness programs. Key features include: 1) Medical Clinic: A fully equipped clinic with examination rooms, treatment areas, and consultation spaces. 2) Pharmacy: On-site pharmacy for prescription medications and over-the-counter items. 3) Wellness Programs: Regular health screenings, fitness classes, and nutritional counseling. 1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.

Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.

#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

response:
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

#*# Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week, we explore the rich flavors of the Mediterranean. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Bruschetta: Toasted baguette slices topped with diced tomatoes, basil, and olive oil. 1.2) Caprese Salad: Fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil drizzled with balsamic reduction. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Grilled Octopus: Tender octopus marinated in olive oil, lemon, and herbs, grilled to perfection. 2.2) Chicken Paillard: Thinly sliced chicken breast stuffed with prosciutto and mozzarella, pan-seared and served with a light tomato sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Roasted Asparagus: Asparagus spears roasted with garlic and olive oil. 3.2) Quinoa Salad: Quinoa mixed with cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and feta cheese, dressed with lemon vinaigrette. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Lemon Tart: A tangy lemon filling encased in a buttery pastry crust. 4.2) Gelato: A variety of artisanal gelatos, including pistachio and stracciatella. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Rosé Wine: Light and refreshing rosé to pair with the seafood. 5.2) Limoncello: An Italian lemon liqueur to cleanse the palate.

#*# Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
A tribute to Asian cuisine this week. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Edamame: Steamed edamame sprinkled with sea salt. 1.2) Spring Rolls: Crispy spring rolls filled with vegetables and served with sweet chili sauce. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Sushi Platter: A selection of fresh sushi rolls, nigiri, and sashimi. 2.2) Kung Pao Chicken: Spicy stir-fried chicken with peanuts, dried chilies, and vegetables. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Fried Rice: Classic Chinese fried rice with eggs, peas, and carrots. 3.2) Kimchi: Traditional Korean fermented cabbage, spicy and flavorful. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Mango Sticky Rice: Sweet sticky rice served with fresh mango and coconut milk. 4.2) Green Tea Ice Cream: A creamy ice cream infused with green tea. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Sake: A traditional Japanese rice wine. 5.2) Jasmine Tea: A fragrant and soothing herbal tea.

#*# Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
A return to classic French cuisine. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Foie Gras: Seared foie gras with a fig compote. 1.2) Escargot: Butter-baked snails in their shells. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Coq au Vin: Slow-cooked chicken in red wine with mushrooms and onions. 2.2) Beef Bourguignon: Braised beef in red wine with pearl onions and mushrooms. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Ratatouille: A stewed vegetable dish made with eggplant, zucchini, bell peppers, and tomatoes. 3.2) Truffle Fries: Crispy fries tossed in truffle oil. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Crème Brûlée: A custard base topped with a caramelized sugar crust. 4.2) Clafoutis: A fruit-based dessert with a soft custard-like texture. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Bordeaux: A full-bodied red wine to complement the hearty dishes. 5.2) Cognac: A fine brandy to finish the meal.

#*# Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
Exploring the flavors of India. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Samosas: Crispy pastries filled with spiced potatoes and peas. 1.2) Chicken Tikka: Marinated chicken skewers grilled to perfection. 2. Drinks: 5.1) Lassi: A yogurt-based drink, either sweet or salty. 5.2) Masala Chai: A spiced black tea.

prompt:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'random of Year Party' on 11-06 with a special dish: Gourmet Cheese Platter.
1.4 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.5 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 08-31 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
2) Feature 'Squash and Pumpkin Delights' from Week 5 to Week 5 with dishes like: Pumpkin Pie.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 9, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. 2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

response:
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

#*# Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
Continuing our celebration of the New Year, we offer a fresh take on traditional favorites.
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare: Finely chopped smoked salmon mixed with capers, onions, and dill, served with crispy toast. 
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: Creamy dip made with spinach, artichokes, and cheese, served with pita chips. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Beef Wellington: Tender beef filet wrapped in puff pastry with a layer of duxelles. 
2.2) Grilled Salmon with Lemon Butter Sauce: Fresh salmon fillet grilled to perfection, drizzled with a light lemon butter sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Asparagus: Asparagus spears roasted with olive oil, salt, and pepper. 
3.2) Truffle Mashed Potatoes: Rich mashed potatoes infused with truffle oil. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Raspberry Sorbet: Refreshing sorbet made with fresh raspberries. 
4.2) Flourless Chocolate Cake: Dense, fudgy cake made with just chocolate and eggs. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Red Wine: A robust red wine to pair with the hearty main courses. 
5.2) White Wine: A crisp white wine to complement the lighter dishes.

#*# Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week, we introduce a blend of international flavors to our menu.
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Ceviche: Fresh fish marinated in lime juice, mixed with onions, peppers, and cilantro. 
1.2) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with diced tomatoes, basil, and garlic. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Chicken Tikka Masala: Marinated chicken pieces cooked in a creamy tomato-based sauce. 
2.2) Beef Bourguignon: Slow-cooked beef stew with red wine and mushrooms. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Basmati Rice: Fluffy rice cooked with aromatic spices. 
3.2) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of carrots, parsnips, and turnips roasted with herbs. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Mango Lassi: A sweet yogurt drink flavored with mango. 
4.2) Apple Crumble: Warm apple crumble with vanilla ice cream. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Beer: A selection of craft beers to enjoy with the meal.

prompt:

1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Independence Day Celebration' on 07-04 with a special dish: American Apple Pie.
1.2 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.3 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 02-07 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.4 Celebrate 'Oktoberfest Beer Dinner' on 10-06 with a special dish: Sausages and Sauerkraut.
